comments: PLEASE avoid this teacher! His syllabus does not say of what we\'ll expect to learn in the semester; 52 card deck lectures were confusing!! gives pop quizzes, & rarely gives HW. Lectures don\'t make sense at times, his notes are scattered & useless. MyMathLab was a waste of time & money since he only assigned 5 HW\'s up until i dropped passed mid-term

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: TEST HEAVY  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
comments: I would avoid this teacher. He does not have a detailed syllabus on when a HW will be assigned; gives pop quizzes. His lectures are frustrating and confusing; just goes through the problems and his notes are disorganized and makes no sense at all. Does not give out that much HW so good luck studying for exams. Oh, and he rarely answers emails!!

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Professor Pandis is awesome. Math can be dreadful, but this professor explains things so thoroughly, he makes math a walk in the park. I personally hate math, but this professor made it easy for me. If I can pass his class, anyone can.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: I haven\'t had a teacher as worse as Pandis for over 2 years. When he teaches, he looks at the board the whole time you\'re there. It\'s like the students aren\'t even present. Goes over problems that he says himself won\'t be on the test, makes no sense. I wish I would have known about him before I took this class, I would have not done so.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: He doesn\'t go through his lectures with passion. When he\'s explaining in class, he starts wherever he wants and moves along without actually going in a specific order. When students ask him questions, he doesn\'t necessarily answer it and they\'re left confused. You basically have to teach yourself through most of the material.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  RESPECTED
comments: Professor Pandis is super nice and explains all math problems thoroughly. I like how he takes his time explaining all formulas and his quizzes are easy. If you pay attention in class, this will be an easy course for you. Attendance is important as you can guess, each class goes through a lot in one day. I would recommend this professor!

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Pandis is the unicorn of the math department. I have been plagued by dread and fear of math for my whole life, and once you decide that you\'re ready to face math and kick it right in the face, Pandis will be there to help you. BUT do yourself a favor and show up everyday and do your homework. That is your responsibility.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Hes a good teacher, has some sense of humor. Stops to explain to those who do not understand. Remembers students by name. He goes step by step to explain even the most stupid stuff if someone asks him. But be quiet in class.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: I hated math before I took this class, but Pandis was a helpful, patient instructor and helped me understand the material. It\'s important to attend all the classes because he covers a lot, but it\'s an easy course. I passed with an A and Math is def. not my subject. Textbook is a must for homework.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Professor Pandis knows his stuff. He is very patient and will re-work problems if we don\'t understand. He is kind and smart and expects students to do the homework and participate. He holds us accountable. I am not good at math but he really does break it down so that it makes sense. Great teacher!

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: This teacher doesn\'t care if the students learn anything he just wants to get through the material. On the last test he said if you had a 63/100 thats good, so that means majority of the class did not do well. I have never heard a teacher say a 63 out of 100 is good. I wish I could drop the class but I have no other choice.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: I took his class this summer and I passed with an A. He\'s not an amazing teacher, but he gets through the material well enough and is helpful when you need it. He doesn\'t make the class difficult, and as long as you do your homework and study enough you can pass.

tag_professor: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Participation matters (2)  Tough Grader (1)  Respected (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: This class may as well be offered online because he goes through the motions without any passion in teaching. If you don\'t understand something he\'ll say you should\'ve learned it in Math99. Went to the tutor every week for several hours. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS

comments: He\'s a good teacher. he explains things well & doesn\'t mind slowing down for students that don\'t understand. He has a LOT of patients, some of my fellow classmates were crazy rude. I hated math before, but now that i understand it i enjoy the class :)
